akn:section.akn:heading: Issues of fact in Supreme Court

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 1872. Issues of fact in Supreme Court In all original actions at law in the Supreme Court against citizens of the United States, issues of fact shall be tried by a jury. (June 25, 1948, ch. 646, 62 Stat. 953.)
Historical and Revision NotesBased on title 28, U.S.C., 1940 ed., § 343 (Mar. 3, 1911, ch. 231, § 235, 36 Stat. 1156). Changes were made in phraseology.
